(A) gasoline evaporating from soil (B) gasoline catching fire in the soil (C) gasoline polluting an old septic system (D) gasoline trickling down into groundwater

[DUPLICATE] A student uses clay to construct a model of Earth. Which layer of the model should be the thinnest layer? (A) the layer representing the mantle (B) the layer representing the outer core (C) the layer representing the inner core (D) the layer representing the crust

[DUPLICATE] A student uses clay to build models of an ocean plate and a continental plate. What characteristic cannot be accurately represented by the models? (A) the shapes of plates (B) the relative sizes of plates (C) the relative densities of plates (D) the arrangement of plates relative to one another

[DUPLICATE] A student has built a model in which sheets of cork floating in a tub of water represent tectonic plates. To make the sheet representing an ocean plate more accurate in the model system, the student should (A) cut several holes in it. (B) attach small weights to it. (C) cut it into a smaller shape. (D) replace it with a thin sheet of copper.

[DUPLICATE] A student is trying to model an ocean environment. What is the most important factor the student should add to the aquarium in order to make sure that the model is accurate? (A) starfish (B) seaweed (C) salt water (D) coral reef

[DUPLICATE] What is the best way to model the effect of wind on sand dunes? (A) Pour a bucket a sand through the air. (B) Pour water over a pile of sand. (C) Filter sand through a screen into water. (D) Blow on a pile of sand through a straw.

[DUPLICATE] A student is creating a model of a stream in a forested mountain watershed. Which of these features might be included in the model to show how the stream could overload with sediment? (A) a cabin near the stream (B) rocks in the middle of the stream (C) acres of cleared forest above the stream (D) grasses growing along the banks of the stream
[DUPLICATE] Which tool will best help scientists understand relationships between oceans and climate changes? (A) a computer model (B) a weather balloon (C) a rain gauge (D) radar

[DUPLICATE] A student wants to create a drawing of the water cycle. Which image can the student use to represent water cycling through the atmosphere? (A) a cloud (B) a stream (C) a frozen lake (D) a drop of dew

[DUPLICATE] A student mixes vinegar and baking soda to use in a volcano model. The mixture causes the volcano model to feel cool when it is touched. What energy transformation has taken place? (A) light energy changed to heat energy (B) heat energy changed to chemical energy (C) chemical energy changed to heat energy (D) chemical energy changed to light energy

[DUPLICATE] A student ties a string around a weight and swings the weight in a circle around her body. If the student represents the Sun and the weight represents Earth, what does the string represent? (A) gravity (B) radiation (C) electricity (D) magnetism

[DUPLICATE] A group of students plans to build a model of a local pond habitat. Which model best represents an environment similar to a pond? (A) a sealed plastic bottle containing insects and algae from a pond (B) a classroom aquarium containing plants and animals bought from a store (C) a classroom aquarium containing freshwater, non-native plants, and non-native animals (D) a small plastic outdoor pool containing freshwater, native plants, and native animals

[DUPLICATE] A computer model of an insect population takes into account the following parameters: * available food resources * annual temperature variation * timing of insect reproductive cycles Which additional parameter would most significantly improve the model's accuracy when predicting the insect population size? (A) decomposers recycling dead insects (B) annual variation in oxygen availability (C) activities of predators preying on insects (D) variation in barometric pressure

[DUPLICATE] Scientists use models that show the features of an atom. A scientist should use a model that (A) was the first to be developed (B) was most recently developed (C) shows the arrangement most clearly (D) shows the details needed for a specific purpose

[DUPLICATE] A teacher builds a model of a hydrogen atom. A red golf ball is used for a proton, and a green golf ball is used for an electron. Which is not accurate concerning the model? (A) number of particles (B) relative mass of particles (C) types of particles present (D) charges of particles present

[DUPLICATE] A model of an atom includes red marbles for electrons, green marbles for protons, and blue marbles for neutrons. All marbles have a radius of 2 cm. How could the model be changed to represent more properties of an atom? (A) by using smaller marbles to represent electrons (B) by using two marbles to represent each neutron (C) by using two differently colored marbles for protons (D) by switching the colors of the marbles
[DUPLICATE] Which model is used by scientists to determine the properties of elements? (1) a Punnett square (2) the Periodic Table (3) a pedigree chart (4) the rock cycle

[DUPLICATE] Sal is looking at a map of Massachusetts. He has measured the distance, in inches, from Boston to Salem on the map. He wants to know how many actual miles the inches represent. What feature of the map should he look for? (A) key (B) scale (C) legend (D) compass
[DUPLICATE] Nick is making a model to show how human skin covers the body. What material would work best? (A) a sheet of rubber (B) a sheet of paper (C) a sheet of metal (D) a sheet of wood

[DUPLICATE] Based on the evidence available at the time, early models of the solar system stated that all objects in space orbited Earth. In the 16th century, an astronomer reevaluated the evidence and proposed a model of the solar system that is still in use. What part of this model corrected the mistake in previous solar system models? (A) The Sun is at the center of this model. (B) Earth is the largest object in this model. (C) This model contains more than one star. (D) This model shows that Earth is stationary.

If a scientist wants the medical community to revise old information and use new research findings in the treatment of a disease, it would be best to present the information (A) at a school science fair. (B) in a newspaper article. (C) at a physicians' conference. (D) in a television commercial.

Using the Internet for a research paper can help a student find many resources. One problem with using information on the Internet is that it might be (A) free. (B) current. (C) detailed. (D) incorrect.

An experiment is being conducted to determine the air quality inside a building. In order to come to a conclusion, scientists must gather data. Which of the following would be an excellent source of data from which to draw a conclusion? (A) naked-eye viewing (B) calculations of air mass (C) demonstrations of air pressure (D) measurement of airborne particulates

Which source of information will most likely provide a student with the most accurate information about the landforms, natural resources, climate, and precipitation of Nevada? (A) the meteorologist from a local television station (B) an Internet article written by university students (C) the Current Events section from a daily newspaper (D) an Internet website developed by the U.S. Geological Survey

Which article might appear in a scientific magazine? (A) "The Religions of South America" (B) "The Money Systems of South America" (C) "The Flora and Fauna of South America" (D) "The Political Systems of South America"

Which source of data about Nevada resources is likely to be most current and reliable? (A) a science encyclopedia (B) an article in a local newspaper (C) a government-maintained website (D) a student's classroom presentation

A student wants to find the most accurate account of a scientific discovery that took place within the past three months. In which of these sources should the student look? (A) newspapers (B) magazines (C) science textbooks (D) science journals
What would be the best source to find information about DNA testing? (A) local newspaper (B) TV news report (C) scientific journals (D) world almanac

Where is the first place a scientist should present new research data about the structure of a galaxy in order to receive the most appropriate review of the research? (A) a high school science classroom (B) a university science blog (C) a peer-reviewed science journal (D) a popular science news magazine
